question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [All functions] [Session exhaustion] Is there a limit on how many concurrent consensus sessions can exist for different (issuer, kid) pairs, or can this be exploited for resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Impl: TConsensusMode] [Trait method consistency] Are the trait method implementations consistent with each other, or can mismatches between new_rb_request() and session_key_from_qc() cause consensus divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Impl: TConsensusMode] [Type safety] Do the associated types (ConsensusSessionKey, ReliableBroadcastRequest) provide sufficient type safety, or can they be confused with similar types from other modes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Impl: TConsensusMode] [Missing validation] Does the trait require implementations to validate inputs, or is validation optional, creating potential security gaps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [QC replay attack] Can old QuorumCertifiedUpdates from previous epochs be replayed to session_key_from_qc() to create duplicate session keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [QC modification] After a QC is created, can any field in qc.update be modified without invalidating the multi_sig, allowing attackers to derive different session keys from the same signature? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [QC forgery] Can attackers create fake QuorumCertifiedUpdate objects with empty or invalid multi_sig fields that still pass through session_key_from_qc()? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: log_certify_done()] [False certification logging] Can log_certify_done() be called with QCs that never actually achieved quorum, misleading operators about consensus state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: new_rb_request(), session_key_from_qc()] [Version zero handling] When ProviderJWKs.version=0, checked_sub(1) fails - is this intentional to prevent base_version=-1, or can this be exploited to block updates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: new_rb_request(), session_key_from_qc()] [Version overflow] Can ProviderJWKs.version be set to u64::MAX, and if try_as_issuer_level_repr() is called, will checked_add(1) overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: new_rb_request(), session_key_from_qc()] [Base version consistency] Are base_version values consistent across all validators for the same (issuer, kid), or can Byzantine validators cause divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: new_rb_request(), session_key_from_qc()] [Version rollback] Can attackers provide QCs with old versions to roll back JWK state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: log_certify_start()] [Sensitive data leakage] Does logging base_version, issuer, and kid expose information that could help attackers time their attacks on JWK updates? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: log_certify_done()] [Log tampering] If logs are the only audit trail for consensus, can attackers manipulate what gets logged to hide their attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: log_certify_start(), log_certify_done()] [Log parsing vulnerabilities] Can malicious issuer/kid values contain escape sequences or formatting that breaks log parsing tools? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: new_rb_request()] [JWK type validation] Does the function validate that the JWK in the payload is of a supported type (RSA, etc.), or can unsupported JWKs be processed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: new_rb_request()] [JWK parameter validation] Are JWK parameters (e.g., RSA modulus size) validated before initiating consensus, or can invalid JWKs enter consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Function: session_key_from_qc()] [JWK consistency] When deriving session keys, is the JWK payload in the QC consistent with what validators expected to certify? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Type: ConsensusSessionKey] [Key uniqueness guarantee] Does the (Issuer, KID) tuple guarantee uniqueness across all possible JWK updates, or can there be collisions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Type: ConsensusSessionKey] [Case sensitivity] Are Issuer and KID compared case-sensitively, and can attackers exploit case differences to create duplicate session keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Type: ConsensusSessionKey] [Normalization] Are Issuer and KID normalized (e.g., URL normalization for issuers) before creating session keys, or can equivalent but different byte representations cause issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [All functions] [Mode confusion] Can PerKeyMode be confused with PerIssuerMode in the consensus system, allowing attackers to mix different consensus modes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [Type: ReliableBroadcastRequest] [Message type confusion] Can ObservedKeyLevelUpdateRequest be misinterpreted as ObservationRequest from per-issuer mode? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [All functions] [Feature flag bypass] If JWK_CONSENSUS_PER_KEY_MODE feature is disabled mid-consensus, what happens to ongoing sessions using PerKeyMode? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/mode/per_key.rs] [All functions] [Feature flag race] Can validators with different feature flag states diverge in their handling of per-key consensus messages? (High)
